definition: content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere

sentences.english: News of the earthquake discomforted us.
sentences.chinese: 地震的消息使我们感到忐忑不安。

sentences.english: That night we all went to sleep uneasy.
sentences.chinese: 当晚我们忐忑不安的上床睡觉。

sentences.english: These problems are very stressful for families and friends.
sentences.chinese: 这些问题令家人和朋友忐忑不安。

sentences.english: Della wriggled off the table and went for him.
sentences.chinese: 德拉忐忑不安地从桌上跳下来，走到他身边。

sentences.english: The farmer went to bed that night feeling troubled.
sentences.chinese: 夜里，农妇躺在床上，忐忑不安辗转难眠。

sentences.english: So I harbored an uneasy feeling to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 所以我怀着忐忑不安的心情入睡。

definition: to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
trembling with fear/with fear and trepidation
at sixes and sevens/perturbed state of mind/in a mess
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
in fear and trepidation (idiom); in reverence before your majesty (court formula of humility)
lit. heart alarmed, trembling in fear (idiom); prostrate with fear/scared witless
